medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant pain with nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began suddenly last night and was sharp, constant, and localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). Initially thought to be a pulled muscle due to participation in an intense Pilates class the day before. Pain radiated towards the umbilicus and epigastrium hours later, then localized back to the RLQ this morning. Associated symptoms include loss of appetite and nausea overnight after the onset of pain; denies vomiting. Reported fever to 101.2Â°F at home last night.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Exercise-induced asthma; previous left inguinal hernia repair.
